enhancedTipsPage.title: Essential Tips for Pet Care
enhancedTipsPage.intro: Take care of your furry friends with these expert tips

hygiene.title: Pet Hygiene
points: Regularly groom your pet to maintain clean fur and prevent matting or skin issues.
Bathe your pet as needed using pet-safe shampoos.
Keep their living space clean, including bedding, litter boxes, and feeding areas.
Trim nails, clean ears, and brush teeth to prevent infections and maintain overall hygiene.
hygiene.quote: Saving one animal won’t change the world, but for that one animal, the world will change forever.

food.title: Pet Food
points: Provide a balanced diet suited to your pet's species, age, and breed.
Avoid feeding human food that can be toxic, such as chocolate, onions, or grapes.
Ensure constant access to clean, fresh water.
Use portion control to prevent overfeeding and obesity.
food.quote: Saving one animal won’t change the world, but for that one animal, the world will change forever.

exercise.title: Exercise and Mental Stimulation
points: Ensure daily walks, playtime, or activities to keep your pet physically active.
Use interactive toys or puzzles to engage their minds and reduce boredom.
Spend quality time with your pet to strengthen your bond and reduce stress.
exercise.quote: Saving one animal won’t change the world, but for that one animal, the world will change forever.

safety.title: Pet Safety
points: Use collars with identification tags and microchip your pet for added safety.
Keep harmful chemicals, sharp objects, and toxic plants out of reach.
Provide a comfortable, safe space for your pet to relax.
safety.quote: Saving one animal won’t change the world, but for that one animal, the world will change forever.

homePage.mainDescription: In various shelters, many pets are waiting just for you, hoping for a loving family and a cozy home—please help them find someone who will love them!
homePage.donationDescription: Your donation can save the lives of countless dogs and cats in need. It provides food, medical care, and shelter while giving them hope for a loving home. Every contribution brings them one step closer to safety, happiness, and a family to call their own. Make a difference today!
homePage.donationPoint1: Your donation provides food and shelter to animals in need.
homePage.donationPoint2: It helps in funding medical treatments for injured pets.
homePage.donationPoint3: You contribute to adoption programs and community outreach.
homePage.donationQuote: Saving one animal won’t change the world, but for that one animal, the world will change forever.
homePage.feedbackDescription: We value your feedback. Let us know how we are doing!
homePage.faq1Question: 1. How does my donation help pets?
homePage.faq1Answer: Your donation provides food, shelter, medical care, and support for rescue and adoption programs.
homePage.faq2Question: 2. Can I choose how my donation is used?
homePage.faq2Answer: Many organizations allow you to specify whether your donation goes toward medical care, food, or spay/neuter programs.
homePage.faq3Answer: Yes, most registered animal welfare organizations provide receipts for tax deductions.
homePage.faq4Question: 4. Can I donate items instead of money?
homePage.faq4Answer: Absolutely! Shelters often accept food, toys, blankets, and other pet supplies.
homePage.faq5Question: 5. How do I know my donation is making a difference?
homePage.faq5Answer: Reputable organizations provide updates, reports, and success stories to show the impact of your support.
homePage.faq6Question: 6. Can I set up recurring donations?
homePage.faq6Answer: Yes, most shelters and organizations allow you to set up monthly or yearly donations for consistent support.

dietGenerator.title: Pet Diet Generator
dietGenerator.waterTip: Always ensure your pet has access to clean, fresh water.
dietGenerator.smallPetTip: Small pets often benefit from more frequent, smaller meals.
dietGenerator.mediumPetTip: Medium-sized pets require a balanced mix of protein, carbs, and healthy fats.
dietGenerator.largePetTip: Large pets may need joint supplements to support their bones.
dietGenerator.glutenFreeTip: Consider gluten-free diets with whole grains like quinoa.
dietGenerator.chickenFreeTip: Switch to alternative proteins like fish or lamb.
dietGenerator.dryFoodMeal1: Dry Food with chicken and sweet potato (serve with water).
dietGenerator.dryFoodMeal2: Dry Food with salmon and peas (serve with water).
dietGenerator.wetFoodMeal1: Wet Food with turkey and carrots (serve with water).
dietGenerator.wetFoodMeal2: Wet Food with lamb and green beans (serve with water).
dietGenerator.rawFoodMeal1: Raw Chicken and rice (serve with water).
dietGenerator.rawFoodMeal2: Raw Salmon and carrots (serve with water).
dietGenerator.grainFreeFoodMeal1: Grain-Free food with turkey and pumpkin (serve with water).
dietGenerator.grainFreeFoodMeal2: Grain-Free food with beef and sweet potato (serve with water).

petCare.title: Pet Care
petCare.description: Pet care is essential to ensure pets live happy, healthy lives through proper nutrition, medical attention, exercise, and love.
